channel.title: hi there, I'm Ben on
channel.description: Recent content in hi there, I'm Ben on

item.title: About
item.description: I am a PhD student at the Icahn School of Medicine at Mt. Sinai in the Artificial Intelligence and Emerging Technologies training area. I do physiological time series machine learning modeling utilizing wearables and sensors data. I previously worked at Evidation Health as a senior data scientist. I have 5+ years experience applying statistical and machine learning models to medical data sets in academic research and health technology settings, as well as expertise in wrangling, mining, analyzing, and visualizing data.

item.title: Research Projects
item.description: For the most up to date publications, see my Google Scholar Contents: Metabolomics AKI and the Heart Masters Project Physics Research PMAFs Longyearbyen, Norway American Geophysical Union Conferences Other Research Metabolomics My published research is primarily in the field of metabolomics. Metabolomics is the large-scale study of small organic molecules (metabolites) within an organism, tissue, or cell. Metabolites are defined as molecules that are less than 1,500 Daltons (or atomic mass units; 1 Dalton â‰ˆ 1 hydrogen atom in mass).

item.description: Running is great! Check out my running route map! If on mobile, this one works better.
